thread.title: 'Anything can happen' Nigel Farage refuses to rule out becoming PRIME MINISTER post-Brexit
thread.title_full: 'Anything can happen' Nigel Farage refuses to rule out becoming PRIME MINISTER post-Brexit

title: 'Anything can happen' Nigel Farage refuses to rule out becoming PRIME MINISTER post-Brexit
text:
This country would have to go through disappointment post-Brexit on a huge, huge scale. If this political class let us down on Brexit, then anything can happen Nigel Farage 
Asked whether he could ever envisage a situation where he was Prime Minister, he said: “I’ve never thought of myself as that, no. 
“I think it’s unlikely but what Brexit showed, what 2016 showed, is that all of the old certainties are out of the window.” 
Morgan probed further and asked the Brexiteer if he would like to be Prime Minister. 
Mr Farage replied: “Not really, no. This country would have to go through disappointment post-Brexit on a huge, huge scale. If this political class let us down on Brexit, then anything can happen.” Nigel Farage in pictures Thu, December 15, 2016 Nigel Farage is a British politician who has been the leader of the UK Independence Party since October 2016. Getty Images 1 of 48 British politician Nigel Farage arrives at Trump Tower on December 15, 2016 in New York City. President-elect Donald Trump and his transition team are in the process of filling cabinet and other high level positions for the new administration. ITV The former Ukip leader said 2016 showed "old certainties are out the window" 
He left viewers on a cliff-edge on whether he would be there to pick up the pieces and repeated: “Anything can happen. If this falls to bits, anything could happen, let’s see.” 
The politician then had a dig at the “liberal media” after TV host joked about Mr Farage and Donald Trump being in power at the same time. 
“So we could end up with the White House with Donald Trump, Number 10 Downing Street with Nigel Farage - where’s my gig in all of this?” asked Morgan. 
Mr Farage replied: “Well once you’ve apologised on behalf of the liberal media for the way you’ve treated me, the world is your oyster, Piers.” 
Earlier in the show, Mr Farage blasted Eurocrats controlling “virtually every aspect of our commercial lives”. 
He said: “To me it was fundamental should we actually have the basic facets of a nation, a nation controls its borders, makes its laws, and puts its own people first, that's what a nation does and that I felt is what we’d surrendered. 
“And a bunch of gutless politicians, without ever telling us the truth, were happy to give that away and I thought to hell with them, I’m going to do something about it and I did.” Related articles
